attributes.action: Make Pads and Tampons Free
attributes.background: Because why should women have to pay so much money for a natural occurrence. People would be against women walking around with period blood everywhere so why should we have to pay!
attributes.additional_details: Once I started my period in a public toilet and the tampons were  £1 for 2 tampons. This is outrageous.

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: BAN letting TWO persons ride on a moped together
attributes.background: Whist in London taking pictures of Shard near Tower of London. Moped with two passengers mounted pavement, came from behind and as passed across the front of my nephew the back seat passenger grabbed the tripod i/c camera and carried on up the road weaving in and out dangerously with traffic.
attributes.additional_details: More than 60 crimes using mopeds or motorbikes were carried out every day in London alone on average over the past year - a 50% increase on the previous 12 months.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Scrap Vehicle Excise Duty and raise excise duty on fuel.
attributes.background: Instead of wasting valuable police resources chasing untaxed drivers, when they should be tackling more serious crime, scrap VED and add 10 pence to the price of a litre of fuel. That way, the more you drive the more you pay.
attributes.additional_details: We all know that manufacturer's fuel consumption figures are very unreliable. This way people will pay the fair amount due in tax based on their consumption and their mileage. It doesn't penalise the drivers who have to have a car because bus services in their rural area are non- existent and without a car they wouldn't be able to get to hospitals for appointments or to the shop for essentials.

attributes.action: Abandon government plans to include calories on all restaurant menus
attributes.background: The government’s plan to list calories on all restaurant menus not only will remove the joy of eating out at restaurants, but also is a cruel hinderance to those recovering from eating disorders. We need a more nuanced way to define what is “healthy” than obsessively listing and tracking calories.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/09/04/plans-force-restaurants-cafes-takeaways-display-calorie-counts/

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Make good facial growth a strategic health priority.
attributes.background: We ask parliament to make good facial growth a strategic health priority, through an early years education programme and through supporting Public Health England to make research, analysis and treatment policy in this area part of their next strategic plan.
attributes.additional_details: More information can be found on www.preventcrookedteeth.com.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid a compulsory element of teacher training.
attributes.background: I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.
attributes.additional_details: Some teachers, who will remain anonymous, have reacted positively to the idea when it was put past them stating that teachers often won't act at all as they don't have the knowledge or confidence to deal with the situation. A compulsory course will provide the confidence to at least approach a student about their mental wellbeing and start working on a solution. This vital next move, which is cheaper than alternatives, can combat the ever-escalating problem which is teenage mental health.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying £50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Make a mandatory minimum sentence for child sex offenders
attributes.background:
To many sex offenders get let of with community punishment orders ect I think there should be more of a deterrent and a mandatory minimum prison sentence. 
Also the public especially those with children should have acces to view if any registered sex offenders live in the area they reside.

attributes.action: Lower the percentage for child maintenance deductions from earnings
attributes.background: The current cms payment scheme for non resident parents has a massive impact on non resident working people that are paying rent and bills for their current living situation. A drop in pay or overtime no less than 25 % will leave you with nothing to pay rent and bills.
attributes.additional_details: Non resident fathers will be left in financial difficulty with the cms payment scheme and would be forced to leave work this is not good for the kids that need money.

attributes.action: Impose a 3 to 5% sales tax for online every day retail purchases- exc food, hols
attributes.background: Town centres are the beating heart of the community in Britain. As well as the environmental impact of ordering everything online, trying it on, sending it back etc big dominant US retailers take money out of the UK with unfair tax dodges. Let's boost the high street, or chancery coffers, with e-VAT

attributes.action: UK to cut ties and impose sanctions on Pakistan until they rerun elections
attributes.background: It has been reported that the recent Pakistani elections were one of the dirtiest and most rigged elections in many years. The media reports that Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz was the main target of election irregularities and rigging across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to the media, Pakistan Army soldiers were present inside every polling station at the end of the polling before the polling count started they intervened and forced every polling agent to leave the polling premises. Political parties in Pakistan have rejected these rigged polls. Pakistan's Election Commission should conduct free and fair elections.

attributes.action: Require companies to tell applicants the status of their job application.
attributes.background: Applicants should have a right to receive a reply from employers. This petition isn’t to push for critical feedback, but a simple “yes, you have a job” or “no, you haven’t." Failure to reply within a reasonable time-frame should be punished by fines, depending on the company's size.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple reply from an employer can help better a person's options. People seeking work explore and apply for various types of employment, unskilled jobs, career and training programs or apprenticeships; and often, many of these jobs would start around the same time. Some options may be better than others depending on the individual, and a simple reply of “yes”, “no” or “still being reviewed” can improve a person on making a better choice financially or for their lifestyle.

Placing an applicant in a state of suspense and stress, sometimes for months when it comes to programs and apprenticeships is a cruel situation to place anyone in, when a feedback about the application will allow an applicant to move on and accept other options.

attributes.action: Change ‘national speed limit’ signs so they show the actual speed for that road
attributes.background: The current National speed limit signs are confusing for most drivers on our roads. If the signs were to display an actual speed limit for any given road this would take away any uncertainty.

attributes.action: Request intervention in Myanmar at the Security Council against genocide
attributes.background: soldiers in Myanmar have committed genocide according to the United Nations . Amnesty International has also found evidence including forensic medical evidence, corroborated witness testimony and satellite imagery of crimes against humanity.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/uk.mobile.reuters.com/article/amp/idUKKCN1GJ167
https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/06/atrocities-against-the-rohingya-how-we-built-the-case-to-implicate-myanmar-military-officials-in-crimes-against-humanity/

attributes.action: Explain how Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources are used & kept safe.
attributes.background:
It was recently reported that the government use what they describe as Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (otherwise known as children) are used in intelligence services. 

If a government is willing to put children at risk the public deserve to know why, when and how they are kept safe.

attributes.action: Hot weather payment to stay cool
attributes.background: Emergency payment for those in need to keep cool in such extreme heat
attributes.additional_details: Cold weather payments are made so people don't die of cold but a person can die of heat stroke just as much

attributes.action: digital tachographs and cpc for private hire vehicles
attributes.background: I would like to see a more professional approach to granting taxi and private hire vehicle licences. The introduction of a digital tachograph into all private hire vehicles and taxi's would create a safer environment for passengers,pedestrians and other road users.
attributes.additional_details: My idea might not be perfect and there may be better technology to monitor the drivers of the vehicles.However I think it would identify a massive black economy. Identifying who is actually driving the vehicle , and the hours they are working. The introduction of a CPC (certificate of professional competence) would be a minimum requirement to send a message to this business sector to improve the standard of driving.

attributes.action: Registration with the charities commission be mandatory for religious bodies.
attributes.background: We need to ensure all religious organisations collecting money are registered with the charities commission. Therefore they must publish their accounts and be willing to have them independently audited for fraud and questionable use of money.

attributes.action: Make fire extinguishers mandatory in tower blocks
attributes.background: Many tower blocks don’t have the minimum safety in case a fire occurs and to prevent any further accident to spread, there should be a law forcing tower blocks to have fire extinguishers

attributes.action: Make Jordan Pickford’s birthday (March 7th) a national holiday
attributes.background: Jordan Pickford has been England’s Number 1 goalkeeper at the 2018 World Cup and he has been brilliant. Jordan Pickford’s birthday should be a national holiday to celebrate his performances at the 2018 World Cup.

attributes.action: Improve the number and quality of care homes
attributes.background: Many children in care experience multiple placements, in some cases going to 8 or more different care homes. This is because care homes either shut down or get too full, so a large number of children in care have nowhere to go and end up on the streets, increasing child poverty numbers.

attributes.action: Set up law to exempt spouse and parents of those KIA from council tax for life
attributes.background:
There is no law at present which exempts spouse and parents of those members of the armed forces, security services, NHS and police killed during their service or when on operations. 
To honour them, I want UK legislation to excuse their spouse and parents from council tax liability for life

attributes.action: Make the history of British colonialism part of high school curriculum.
attributes.background: Too many people, especially the new generation do not know anything about the British empire or the colonies which helped make Britain great. Some people are also oblivious to the pain and suffering the Empire caused as well as all the positive impacts it had to less affluent countries.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is a huge multicultural society. Our society, whatever their background need to be taught where they came from and how they got to the positions they are in now. It’s a too wider misconception that there has just been constant mass migrations for no apparent reason. I believe if the history of the British Empire were taught then a lot of what is happening in the present would be sympathised with and more could be done to resolve issues by all ethnicities.

attributes.action: Alter "laws" that bar certain Brits from jobs with the Secret Service.
attributes.background: The Home Office, FCO, MI5,MI6,HMGCC & other Gov’ Offices reject applicants simply because they don’t have a British Parent with British ties; even if they have a Naturalization Certificate and a British Passport. That these documents do “NOT” make one British enough to be appointed is unacceptable!
attributes.additional_details: Evidence is the Criterium openly set out as advertised on the Foreign Offices’ websites and MI5, MI6, also enshrined in UK Law.

attributes.action: Full Public Investigation into all Unresolved Complaints of NHS Medical Errors
attributes.background: For over 40 yrs, the system has failed to protect patients who have suffered medical accidents/errors under the NHS. A toxic culture has prevailed within the NHS of closing ranks to cover up complaints. We need a new body to investigate all unresolved complaints and the misuse of powers/public money
attributes.additional_details: Given the gravity of scale of covering up by the NHS & lack of action taken by complaint bodies & those in Government, this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate all complaints. In order to avoid harm to patients the government need to carry out an investigation across the UK to identify the systemic failure across the NHS & avoid future harm to patients. It must include victims left with ongoing health problems/disabilities & families who have lost a loved one since 1980

attributes.action: Provide clarity around the powers & legislation of bailiffs & civil enforcement
attributes.background: Civil enforcement agencies and bailiffs are a private entity which are used to recover debt. There have been a large number of cases where these enforcement agents are providing misleading information occupiers at properties which generally leaves no choice but to make payments in full.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to this lack of clarity police are called to such instances around 89% of times, wasting police time as they can not enforce anything except ensure there is no breach in peace as the matter is of a civil nature. 

If warrants had stated thereon the powers of entry a bailiff or enforcement may have according to the type of warrant they are present to execute, this would be beneficial all parties including the police as they generally have no knowledge about the rights of these agents

attributes.action: Introduce retail transaction tax and abolish retailers’ business rates
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  This disproportionate cost is contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% retail business rate tax on each sales transaction value rather than property space would be a fairer arrangement and would be directly linked to the business’s success rather than the cause of its failure. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place. The credit card holder’s physical location (in-store) or credit card address (online) are readily available for re-allocation to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Remove the household means assessment from student loans for all adult students.
attributes.background:
Parental maintenance cease at 18. The UK government assesses an entitlement to a student loan for an adult upon the income of people who live in their household but may have had no previous financial responsibility for ? 
Allow all students to apply for the maximum award. It’s all repayable
attributes.additional_details: The student loan assessment is unfair. A common example is where a students mother lives with a new partner. The partner earns a good salary and pays maintenance for his existing children - however the student applying for university must ask this man, who s/he may only have known for a year for their financial details. Then will be awarded a lesser sum because of this man income . With the expectation that he will top up the reduced loan. This rarely happens leaving the student disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Introduce a (5%) Voluntary Tax where people can allocate as they choose
attributes.background: There is a lot of shouting about the lack of funds here and there. NHS, education, police and soforth. But no-one especially wants a tax raise, especially when their funds are tight. What this idea is a voluntary tax, but one where a person can specifically choose where that tax goes.
attributes.additional_details:
The way it would work it would be something that people can opt-in, or opt-out. Opt-in of a voluntary tax, and they would then pick a choice where they want that payment of tax to be allocated. For example.
>NHS >Education >Roads >Railways >Military etc.

attributes.action: Condemn killings by the Indian government
attributes.background: On 23rd May 2018, Indian and local Tamil Nadu government forces killed 13 unarmed civilians protesting against environmental disaster created by Sterlite copper in Tuticorin, TN owned by Vedanta resources plc.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must condemn this human rights violation and urge the India Government to protect human rights, including people’s right to protest.

attributes.action: Allow the purchase of alcohol between 8am and 11pm
attributes.background: The purchase of alcohol should be allowed between 8am and 11pm as the times the law describe are just too late. I have personal relations with close friends who are heavily reliant on alcohol and need it for medicinal reasons but have to endure a long mornings and nights in pain.
attributes.additional_details: It is understood the reasons for the times that are set but i honestly feel the reasons behind this law have now become mostly irrelevant. It is unfair on these people who have to suffer most mornings and nights because of this. It is hard seeing close ones in these situations.

attributes.action: Establish an Atrocities Prevention Board.
attributes.background: Human rights and the prevention of mass atrocities should be at the centre of our foreign policy thinking. An Atrocities Prevention Board, made up of representatives from across government, would ensure a comprehensive approach to identify and address threats to vulnerable groups of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Barack Obama established an Atrocities Prevention Board (ABP) in 2012. It has improved the US government's ability to identify early threats and widened the tools with which those threats can be dealt with. It has also provided the impetus to take early action in a number of countries that might otherwise not have received such attention.

A UK equivalent could spur on a similar change and ensure that genocide and mass atrocity prevention are a priority at the highest levels of government.

attributes.action: The Government Must Cut Waiting Times For Children’s Mental Health Services
attributes.background: We call on the government to tackle the mental health epidemic at the root, and fast - to do this it needs to cut waiting times for children (5-16 years old), shortening its timeline to introduce maximum waiting times by 2022-23. If not, our country will lose countless young lives in the meantime.
attributes.additional_details: On May 9 two committees of MPs published a report saying the government's plans will take too long to come into effect and will ‘fail a generation’. On average, a child waits a decade from the moment they suffer their first symptom of poor mental health to receiving treatment. At such a crucial stage in children's development, mental health issues should be treated as a matter of urgency. Diagnosing and treating issues early will help deal with problems before they develop into something worse.

attributes.action: Remove home address from UK Driving Licence.
attributes.background: Most people carry their driving licence and house keys together.  Having your home address on the licence is unnecessary as all information will be attached to the licence number.  It's time to end this potentially dangerous practice.

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: life in prison for those that cause death through drink driving
attributes.background: As a biker I know of far too many lives affected throughbdrink driving

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for every  child to be taught first aid in secondary school
attributes.background: The uk has a very low out of hospital cardiac arrest survival rate of 8.1% compared to other countries such as Denmark where 22% of OHCA patients arrive at hospital still alive. By teaching first aid we can make everyone in time have the ability to carry out lifesaving first aid

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Public investigation into treatment of people with autism/learning difficulties
attributes.background: Call on the government to investigate and reform the law so that the rights of parents, guardians or next of kin of people with autism/learning difficulties cannot be removed. Re: https://news.sky.com/story/40-people-died-in-barbaric-secure-hospitals-the-government-pledged-would-close-11540038
attributes.additional_details: It is in the general public’s best interest an investigation is carried out into the circumstances of the loss of life of people with a profound learning disability or autism who have died while admitted to secure hospitals or care homes over the last 40 yrs. Currently more than 2000 people are in assessment and treatment units with an average stay of more than 5 ½ years when they are supposed to be discharged within 18 months and their families do not have any right in deciding their treatment

attributes.action: Abolish fines for parents requesting absence from school.
attributes.background: My mum wanted to take my three little sisters on holiday abroad. She nor my sisters have seen my grandmother in nine years, and now that have finally been able to save up to go during Christmas time, they risk being fined £60 per child per leave of absence.
attributes.additional_details: All of my sisters have excellent attendance, why should my mum have to pay over £900 pounds for missing five days of school?

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on England leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Scottish have had the chance to vote for independence, it’s about time the English had the same right.

attributes.action: Ban religious studies in schools
attributes.background: Religion does not belong in the school system. I do not send my child to school to learn about religion - that is what church is for.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for under 16's to have internet access on their mobile phones!
attributes.background: Children exposed to pornography at 9, cyber bullying see evidence link. Teenagers committing suicide because of cyber bullying, outrageous! They need constant supervision with the internet! It is far too dangerous and the safety of our children is the most important. It goes beyond parents control.
attributes.additional_details:
https://foreverymom.com/mom-gold/horror-stories-real-dont-give-children-smartphone-jonathon-van-maren/

I will give my daughter a cell phone when she is in year 6 and practising getting to school on her own ready for high school, but it will not have access to the internet, thats not going to stop other children who do have internet access from showing her inappropriate pictures or posting things about her though is it! For this to stop it needs to be illegal. They do not need internet access!

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.
